articles.title: Moths are more important for pollination than we thought
articles.description: Time-lapse cameras are uncovering how crucial night-time visits from moths are for pollinating red clover, a valuable forage crop
articles.content:
By Gary Hartley
The large yellow underwing (Noctua pronuba) pollinates red clover flowers at night
Shutterstock/Natalia Zagaja
Spying on the nocturnal visits of moths to plants has exposed the ins… [+374 chars]

articles.title: Ancient Aboriginal rock art may reveal how Australia's climate changed
articles.description: Murujuga in Western Australia holds more than 2 million engravings that have been added over at least 50,000 years - and may provide a glimpse into how the region's climate and vegetation have changed
articles.content:
By Alice Klein
Rocks on Middle Gidley island in Murujuga, Western Australia, that typify the landscape
Alice Klein

articles.title: Climate change could cause heavier rainfall on volcanoes
articles.description: The majority of Earth’s volcanoes could see heavier rainfall due to climate change which could increase eruptions and mud slides
articles.content:
By James Dinneen

Aditya Irawan/NurPhoto via Getty Images

articles.title: Deer in Costa Rica gnaw on sea turtle bones
articles.description: White-tailed deer in the Guanacaste Conservation Area in Costa Rica have been spotted regularly chewing on sea turtle bones. The behaviour may be an attempt to get to boost nutrient intake
articles.content:
By Jake Buehler
Some white-tailed deer munch on sea turtle bones
Jaguar Research Program of the National University of Costa Rica

articles.title: How to spot wildlife at the beach - and how not to disturb or harm it
articles.description: Coastal habitats offer many opportunities for nature spotting, from marine mammals like whales and dolphins, to breeding seabirds and rare wildflowers. Here's how to make the most of your trip to the beach, without harming any wildlife
articles.content:

If you’re lucky you could see common seals (Phoca vitulina) but it’s kind to keep your distance

articles.title: Tracing lithium's atomic signature could help make ethical batteries
articles.description: Lithium is used in batteries for smartphones, laptops and electric vehicles, but some mines have been accused of creating environmental and social problems. A way to trace the origin of the metal could ensure producers only use ethical sources
articles.content:
By Jason Arunn Murugesu
Lithium batteries are used to power electric cars
asharkyu/Shutterstock
A way of tracing the origin of lithium could help hold battery producers accountable and ensure that… [+2560 chars]

articles.title: Chemicals from plastic bag pollution could unbalance ecology of lakes
articles.description: Study of 29 lakes in Scandinavia finds that leachate from plastic bags boosts the productivity of bacteria, but that's not necessarily good news for aquatic ecosystems
articles.content:
By Adam Vaughan
A lake in Norway that was part of the study
SG Woodman

articles.title: Robot that learns social cues could feed people with tetraplegia
articles.description: Feeding robot works out when people are ready for their next mouthful by watching for social signs, which could make it easier to socialise for those who can’t use their arms
articles.content:

This robot arm uses artificial intelligence to assess if it is a good time to feed someone a mouthful

articles.title: Hackers can turn computer cables into antenna to steal sensitive data
articles.description: Computers are sometimes kept disconnected from the internet, or "air gapped", to avoid remote hackers gaining access to steal data, but now there is a way to use a hard drive cable to transmit information via radio waves
articles.content:
By Matthew Sparkes
SATA cables are found in most computers
Shutterstock/Nor Gal

articles.title: Long covid symptoms may include hair loss and ejaculation difficulties
articles.description: A study of 2.4 million health records suggests the World Health Organization's set of 33 long covid symptoms may be too limited
